{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant document (Document [0]) discusses the evaluation of antiseptics used for skin and mucous membranes in the presence of interfering substances. The study tested three antiseptic solutions: a chlorhexidine-benzalkonium (CB) combination, a hexamidine-chlorhexidine-chlorocresol (HCC) combination, and povidone iodine (P). The results showed that only CB had bactericidal activity in dirty conditions. Therefore, the answer is yes, the bactericidal activity of the antiseptic solutions was improved according to the NF EN 13727 European Standard.", "answer_choice": "A"}
